bibl.title: Marie Le Fevre, Yvonne Le Fevre, & Georgette Normand v. M. Angelique. Order
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

person.persName: Marie Le Fevre, Yvonne Le Fevre, & Georgette Normand

div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES CIRCUIT FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION

In the Matter of the Application of James P. Levin and Sister Superior M. Angelique, for a writ of certiorari} No.1078 Supplement Retun and petition for re-hearing and modification of order and judgment.
In the matter of the Application of Vonne Le Fevre, Georgette Normand and Marie Le Fevre for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.

Come now the petitioners and respondents herein, James P. Lavin and Sister Superior M. Angelique, by Edward E. Cushman, Assistant United States Attorney, and for a supplemental retern and petition for modification of judgement heretofore rendered herein, show the Court:

That the attached writ of habeas corpus sued out of the State Court was served on your petitioner, Sister Superior M. Angelique, on the 13th day of Febuary, 1903; that on the 20th day of February, 1903, after the making of the Court's order herein on the 19th day of February, 1903, the Secretary of Tresury nade and issued the following finding and warrant of deportation:
James P. Lavin, Immigrant Inspector, Care Deputy Collector, Seattle, Wn.

Whereas it is known to my satifaction that Marie Lefevre Yvonne Lefevre and Georgett Normade entered this county in vilation of law at the Port of New York will arrest them and convey them to New York for deportation at expense of the White Star line for so doing, this is sufficient warrant. Engage amtron at two dollars per diem and expenses both ways to assist you in makingdeportation.

That petitioners respectfully show the Court that the matter and question of the country to which the applicants for writ of habeas corpus,
Yvonne Le Fevre, Marie Le Fevre and Georgette Normand, should be deported is solely within the jurisdiction and authority of the Tresury Department, and that the Court is withought jurisdiction and authority therein, and that it is impossible for your petitioners to comply both with the Court's prder and the Secretary's warrant.

Wherefore, your petitioners pray that the order heretofore made herein on the 19th day of Februrary, 1903, by re-considered by the Court and modified by stiking out the Court's finding of law therein, and the following words, "to be him placed and returned upon the steamship Rosalie to be by said vessel and at its own expense returned to Victoria, british Columbia", thereby leaving your petitioners free to carry into effect the warrant of the Secretary of the Tresury.
Edward Cushman Assistant United States Attorney.
Unites States of America District of Washington} SS.

James P. Lavin, being first dully sworn, on oath says: That he is one of the petitioners named in the foreging petition; that he has read the foregoing petition, knows the contents thereof, and belives the same to be true.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 3rd day of March, 1903.
A Reeves Avres Clerk U A Com
